message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.NE 

This paper deals with reinforcement learning, specifically policy gradient methods, and their convergence properties. It also introduces the concept of limiting the change in policy to a small Wasserstein distance, which falls under the category of optimization and control. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also involves information theory (cs.IT) and neural networks (cs.NE), which are relevant sub-categories.
